body_html:
Note: it gets copied for packaging here:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.sh#L118

So a symlink should exist at bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so after build.

I verified that deleting that file still allows us to build the .whl package successfully since we don't do any explicit checks.

So a symlink should exist at bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so after build.
I verified that deleting that file still allows us to build the .whl package successfully since we don't do any explicit checks.
body:
Note: it gets copied for packaging here:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.sh#L118

So a symlink should exist at `bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package.runfiles/org_tensorflow/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so` after build.

I verified that deleting that file still allows us to build the .whl package successfully since we don't do any explicit checks.
